snippet: Injuries found during the autopsy of a Palestinian prisoner who died in Israeli detention were said to be characteristic of the resuscitation attempts performed on the deceased.
abstract: Israeli Health Ministry says that tests show that hemorrhages and fractured ribs found during autopsy on Palestinian prisoner Arafat Jaradat, who died in Israeli detention, are characteristic of resuscitation attempts performed on deceased; findings counter Palestinian officials' claims that signs point to torture.
lead_paragraph: Injuries found during the autopsy of a Palestinian prisoner who died in Israeli detention were said to be characteristic of the resuscitation attempts performed on the deceased.

headline.main: Israel: Autopsy of Detainee Shows Signs of ‘Resuscitation Attempts’
headline.print_headline: Israel: Autopsy of Detainee Shows Signs of ‘Resuscitation Attempts’
